section.para: Represents one (of possibly many) inflected forms of the headword. Example: .

listitem.para: tag optional (zero or one). Non-empty string. An abbreviation, a code or some other string of text which identifies the inflected form, for example pl for plural, gs for genitive singular, com for comparative. The inflectedFormTag object type can be used to explain the meaning of the inflection tags, to constrain which inflection tags are allowed to occur in the lexicographic resource, and to map them onto external inventories and ontologies.
text required (exactly one). Non-empty string. The text of the inflected form.
listingOrder required (exactly one). Number. The position of this inflected form among other inflected forms of the same entry. This can be implicit from the serialization.

example.title: RDF
example.programlisting:
<entry> dmlex:inflectedForm [
  dmlex:text "..." ;
  dmlex:tag "..." ;
  dmlex:listingOrder 1 ;
  dmlex:label ... ;
  dmlex:pronunciation ... .

listitem.para: The inflectedForm object is intended to model the inflectional morphology of a headword. To model derivational morphology, for example feminine forms of maculine nouns, the recommended way to do that in DMLex is to create separate entries for the two words, and link them using the Linking Module.
